originalText.text: Bowery Residents’ Committee (“B.R.C.”) is one of New York City’s most comprehensive social services agencies, serving the City’s homeless population as well as many individuals whose mental health issues, substance abuse, or some combination of the two place them acutely at risk of becoming homeless.  The agency seeks to provide clients with knowledge, skills, and social supports that promote health and help combat the desire to use.  Through fostering in clients a sense of responsibility and value in and through finding and maintaining a home, BRC seeks to ultimately awaken in them confidence in their own capabilities to achieve permanent independence.  Perhaps no site is more appropriate than the address at which BRC Columbo Hall currently sits to provide such outreach.  As depicted in the accompanying photo below, the 1980s saw parents in this East Harlem community decorate every window of the abandoned building that was later to become BRC Columbo Hall with dolls and stuffed animals.  Their goal: to remind people selling drugs that children too lived on East 118th Street between Third and Second Avenues.

originalText.text: From what i see. Residents are constantly struggling with basic daily living skills. The K2 smoking is ramped among residents. Patients are seeking help. To understand the process yet have not gotten any insight
